articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran and the United States will hold high-level talks in Oman on Saturday aimed at jump-starting negotiations over Tehran's fast-advancing nuclear programme, with U.S. President Donald Trump threatening military action if there is no deal.
articles.title: Iran, US to start talks in Oman under shadow of regional conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a barrage of drones in an overnight attack on Ukraine, injuring four people and damaging residential and commercial buildings in Kyiv and other parts of the country, Ukrainian officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Russia launches scores of drones on Ukraine, four people injured, Kyiv says

articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration wants to strike 90 trade deals in 90 days, but the challenges to quickly resolving the president's trade war are already apparent.
articles.title: Trump trade team chases 90 deals in 90 days. Experts say good luck with that

articles.author: Liz Lee, Jeff Mason
articles.description: A week of turmoil unleashed by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs showed little sign of easing on Friday, with markets again tumbling and foreign leaders trying to work out how to respond to a dismantling of the world trade order.
articles.title: Trump's tariff pause brings little relief as recession risk lingers

articles.author: Sam Tabahriti, Alistair Smout
articles.description: British lawmakers were recalled for an emergency session on Saturday to vote on laws to keep British Steel's blast furnaces open, as the government said a full nationalisation of the UK's last maker of virgin steel was becoming increasingly likely.
articles.title: UK seeks emergency powers to take control of British Steel

articles.author: Krisztina Fenyo, Gergely Szakacs
articles.description: Several thousand Hungarians mocked right-wing Prime Minister Viktor Orban's moves to ban the annual Pride march by LGBTQ+ groups, dressed in grey and carrying banners ironically denouncing colours and diversity at a rally in central Budapest.
articles.title: Protesting Hungarians mock Orban's anti-LGBT moves, saying 'Let's all be the same'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's capital hunkered down on Saturday as rare typhoon-like gales swept northern regions, forcing the closure of historic sites and disrupting travel while bringing late snowfalls and hailstone showers in some areas.
articles.title: Cold winds sweep Beijing, closing key sites, disrupting travel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italy has no intention for now of using budget leeway allowed by the European Union to boost its defence spending, its economy minister said on Saturday, despite U.S. pressure to increase military expenditure.
articles.title: Italy not planning to use EU budget leeway for defence spending boost

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces have completed the encirclement of Gaza's Rafah, the military said on Saturday, part of an announced plan to seize more areas of the enclave, accompanied by large-scale evacuations of the population.
articles.title: Israeli forces have completed encirclement of Gaza's Rafah, military says

articles.author: Jonathan Allen
articles.description: A U.S. immigration judge said she lacked the authority to overrule a decision concerning Khalil that Secretary of State Marco Rubio made last month under a 1952 law called the Immigration and Nationality Act.
articles.title: US immigration judge rules Palestinian Columbia student Khalil can be deported
